answers.content: Because someone forgot to release the Back-End and they already left to The Hamptons
Because the FE forgot to update their API spec, and now I'm learning React at 9pm on a Friday
Because AWS bounced only half of the servers, and now I'm looking for an senior manager to approve another release - but they are all in The Hamptons
Because the SQL fixtures didn't fully worked, and now I'm manually changing the DB at a 11pm on a Friday
Because I forgot to rebase, and now I find myself copy paste code from GitHub website at 7pm on a Friday
Because we had an happy hour at noon and I have to release drunk
Because the SSL certificate expired in the middle of the build process, and now all you see is 404
Corporate forces you to update your O.S, and now you're spending Friday night watching 99% bar for three hours
Jessica from the data team typed "True" instead of "true]", and you can't understand why it is 10pm and you keep refreshing AWS
/dev/sda1 is full and you need to choose if to"rm -rf" and get a drink, or start the back-up process
You have an Nginx problem without a stack overflow answer on a Friday at 7pm
A problem in a makefile at 2pm - and you didn't understood C in college, now you have to learn it at 4pm on a Friday
Because on 6pm on a Friday, you forgot a "here 123" print. But no one is in the office to approve your "fix type" PR
